content.webTitle: Pop review: Carla Bruni, Comme Si De Rien N'Etait

fields.headline: Pop review: Carla Bruni, Comme Si De Rien N'Etait
fields.bodyText: Carla has what's expected from French pop divas: stunning looks, husky vocals and songs about les amours d'antan. It worked a treat on her folksy 2003 debut, but here she mopes between MOR flavours; cafe swing, string quartet, dreary waltzes and faux blues. The songs have their moments, but their creator sounds as sulkily uninvolved as a model at a boorish party.
